name: Sofitel Brussels Europe

reviews.text: I stayed at the Sofitel Brussels on Thursday, April 11th, 2013. As my favorite hotel, The Dominican, Brussels, was fully booked, I decided the stay at the Sofitel. Although I prefer The Dominican Hotel (better location, better beds, lovely bar, lounge and court-yard and a very special Design), the Sofitel gave me a great experience. The check-in by a very friendly lady was a little slow. The room was perfect, although the design is a little "bland". The check out was very good, friendly and fast. If next time The Dominican will not be available again, then for sure i will stay at the Sofitel.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in Brussels

reviews.text: I have stayed one night in this hotel for business reasons. The staff ist very friendly and professional. I was upgradet for free. The facilities are clean and everything is fine. The quality of the breakfast ist very good. I have enjoyed my stay.
reviews.title: Very good hotel for a stax in Brussels

reviews.text: Very modern beautiful breakfast and very spacious room with big bathroom clean n very comfortable. Centrally located close to all shops and restaurant. I went December time before Christmas they had a open market which was brilliant with plenty of food stalls n souvenir. I got myself a chain with a real wolf claw as pendant at a bargain price.
reviews.title: Centrally located n the best bed ever

reviews.text: The Sofitel has a very modern European ambience and is centrally located within walking distance of the train station and the Grand Place. Shopping, restaurants, and museums are all close by and the staff is friendly and helpful. We took a day trip to Brugge and it was an easy one hour train ride. The lobby has several computers for use by guests, so we didn't need to pack a laptop or visit an internet café. We did not have time to enjoy the gym, but the facilities looked very good and there is also a restaurant and bar at the hotel.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: I have really enjoyed my 3 nights stay with my wife and the little baby at the end of March.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Great Staff

reviews.text: Stayed at Sofitel for the Easter bank holiday weekend, and cannot fault the hotel or staff at all. The porters were very helpful with our luggage and the lady at reception was very welcoming. Our room was spacious with plenty of storage, really good shower, and a very comfortable bed. We travelled a lot by metro and the nearest is about a 7 min walk away, and it actually didn't take very long at all to get to the city centre. The immediate area around the hotel was pretty quite, a few restaurants, cafe's and supermarket, on Sundays there's a lovely market on your doorstep. Overall really enjoyed our stay, could not fault anything at all!!
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel, really lovely staff

reviews.text: Of course, the Sofitel Europe is a nice hotel - it should be, boistering 5 stars, but it does not live up to its classification. Just some examples:
reviews.title: 5 Star Hotel? Not really!

reviews.text: - after arrival I had to get back to the reception desk twice because the electronic key didn't work (during my stay I saw at least six other guests with the same problem!)
reviews.title: Excellent location, excellent hotel

reviews.text: - on the second day of my three nights stay the key again didn't work
reviews.title: Lovely modern stylish hotel

reviews.text: - I'm keen to save the environment but what Sofitel has on offer as water pressure in the showers is a laugh. It took me twice the time to get a shower there than at home because I couldn't get the shampoo outof my hair (and, yes, we do have water conserving showerheads at home)
reviews.title: Very good location

reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location near EU buildings. It is about 4 metro stops away from the centre of town. I wouldn't have wanted to stay in the centre anyway as too busy and touristy. Room was nice (standard room). Quite large with a Bose radio and blackout curtains. Turndown service every evening with chocolates on the pillow! The bed and pillows were very comfortable and I slept very well. Nice tea selection in the room but no black tea for some reason.
reviews.title: Good hotel in a nice location. Solid 4.5

reviews.text: The Shower was weak and water temperature variable so that was disappointing. But bathroom is good size and you get Hermes toiletries.
reviews.title: take all efforts to think for the customer

reviews.text: One of the nicer hotels I have stayed in but I am not sure i would call it a "luxury" hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel in great location

reviews.text: The hotel is nice and the staff are really nice and warm.
reviews.title: Great Luxury Hotel
Sofitel
reviews.text: When I arrived, I was told that there is an open-market during weekend outside the hotel and started from 4-5am. To avoid the disturbance of my sleeping, they upgraded my room to another side without paying more. This is really nice and careful thinking for the customer. Therefore, I really have a very nice stay and good sleep during my stay over the weekend.

Although geared up as a business hotel the location and comfort would make for an equally enjoyable leisure stay. The bed was fantastic, soundproofiong excellent and the temperature control was good. A Bose speaker allows you to plug in your ipod. The square out from has good bars and restaurants and the Frites stand claimed to be the best in Europe. Its a bit of a walk to the old square and some of the other sights but it is somewhere I would recommend.
reviews.title: Very comfortable
Great Modern Hotel, but out of Tourist Centre
reviews.text: Stayed here for my birthday for two nights. Classic room which was well equipped and was ideal and luxurious. Breakfast a bit pricey at 130 euros for two for two nights, but I suppose this is a five star hotel. Great hotel for a stay in Brussels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the hotel for a weekend in Brussels together with the Eurostar ticket. The deal is very very good although the breakfast is not included so maybe double check if you can get that upfront as we paid 130 euros at checkout. On the plus side, the food is excellent.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Brussels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is a very nice, modern hotel. It isn't in the center which was a minor inconvenience for us as tourists but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but the location is not that great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A good hassle-free stay at a big chain hotel.
reviews.title: Good, but not excellent!

description: Set in the heart of the European quarter, Sofitel Brussels Europe is a truly elegant Brussels Belgium hotel - just a short walk from the European institutions. Enjoy gracious hospitality within our Brussels hotel accommodations, which sit on the colorful Jourdan Place - at the doorstep of the peaceful Leopold Park, near the museums of Cinquantenaire Park and the exceptional Félix Hap garden. The Grand Place is a few minutes from our Brussels city center hotel via metro or taxi.
